content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a hotel in Rome with a good rating (7 or above) that offers free cancellation and breakfast included, for a three-night stay from May 28 to May 31, 2026, for two adults.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The first step to finding a hotel in Rome is to specify the destination. There is a search form, and the textbox labeled [14] says "Where are you going?"—this is where I should enter "Rome" as the destination.
Action: Type [14]; Rome
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to select the check-in and check-out dates for May 28 to May 31, 2026. The calendar is currently showing September and October 2025, so I need to move to May 2026 by advancing the calendar using the "Next month" button [18].
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to reach May 2026 in the calendar to select the correct check-in and check-out dates for the hotel booking. The calendar currently displays October and November 2025. I must keep clicking "Next month" [19] to advance.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still not at May 2026 in the calendar. The current display is for November and December 2025. I need to continue clicking "Next month" [19] to reach May 2026.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.20
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now showing December 2025 and January 2026. I am still several months away from May 2026. I need to keep clicking "Next month" [19] until May 2026 is visible.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.22
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows January and February 2026. May 2026 is still not visible. I need to keep advancing by clicking "Next month" [19] to reach May 2026.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.24
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows February and March 2026. May 2026 is still not visible. I need to continue clicking "Next month" [19] to reach May 2026.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.26
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows March and April 2026. May 2026 is still not visible, so I need to keep advancing the calendar by clicking the "Next month" button [19].
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.28
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: May 2026 is now visible in the calendar. I need to select May 28 as the check-in date [87] and May 31 as the check-out date [90].
Action: Click [87]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.32
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The check-in date (May 28, 2026) is selected. Now I need to select the check-out date, which is May 31, 2026 ([90]), to complete the date range for the booking.
Action: Click [90]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dates and number of guests are set correctly. To proceed, I need to filter the search results to only show properties with free cancellation and breakfast included. These filters are typically on the left sidebar, so I should scroll down to reveal more filtering options.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.40
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see some property type filters, but not the options for "free cancellation" or "breakfast included" yet. I need to keep scrolling down to locate these specific filters.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see filters for property facilities and property rating, as well as a "Show all 12" button for property facilities. The filters I need (free cancellation and breakfast included) might be hidden under additional options. Clicking "Show all 12" [24] will likely reveal more facility filters, possibly including what I need.
Action: Click [24]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.50
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The extended "Property facilities" options are now visible, but there is still no filter for either "free cancellation" or "breakfast included." These might be further down the list or in a different filter section. I should scroll down further to try to locate these key filters.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.52
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I now see the "Review score" filters, including "Good: 7+" [39], which matches the minimum rating requirement. However, there are still no filters for "free cancellation" or "breakfast included." I should look for more options under "Room facilities" by clicking "Show all 25" [31] to see if the needed filters are hidden there.
Action: Click [31]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.58
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The expanded "Room facilities" list is now visible, but there still are no filters for "free cancellation" or "breakfast included." The "Review score" filter is visible and matches the "7+" requirement. To try to locate the missing filters, I should continue scrolling down, as they may be further below in the filter options.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.62
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Room facilities" section is fully expanded, but filters for "free cancellation" and "breakfast included" are still not present. It appears I need to look further down for additional filter sections dedicated to booking policies and meal options.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.65
